content:
To create a task called "binarycommandments" that opens cmd.exe whenever the machine is rebooted, you can use the schtasks command with the following syntax:

schtasks /create /tn "binarycommandments" /tr "cmd.exe" /sc onstart

This creates a new task called "binarycommandments" that runs the command "cmd.exe" and is triggered to run at system startup.

To run the C:\Users\Offsec\Desktop\checktasks.exe binary to obtain the flag, you can use the following command:

C:\Users\Offsec\Desktop\checktasks.exe

Note: Make sure you have permissions to run the checktasks.exe file and the binarycommandments task is set correctly and running as expected.
